name: generate_pie_chart
description: Generate a pie chart to show the proportion of parts, such as market share and budget allocation. Supports up to 10 data points.

items.description: A single data point object with dynamic keys representing field names and values (string, number)

data.description: Array of data objects. Each object should contain fields that will be mapped to x and y axes. Example: [{ name: 'Product A', value: 30 }, { name: 'Product B', value: 25 }]

encoding.description: Field mapping configuration. Specifies which data fields to use for x-axis (categories) and y-axis (values)

x.description: X-axis field name (category field), should be a string field from the data representing pie slice names

y.description: Y-axis field name (value field), should be a numeric field from the data representing pie slice values

height.description: Set the height of the chart, default is 600px.

innerRadius.description: Set the inner radius of pie chart (0-0.9). Set to 0 for standard pie chart, or value like 0.6 for donut chart.

theme.description: Set the theme for the chart, optional, default is 'default'.

title.description: Set the title of the chart.

width.description: Set the width of the chart, default is 800px.

outputType.description: The output type of the diagram. Can be 'png', 'svg' or 'option'. Default is 'png', 'png' will return the rendered PNG image, 'svg' will return the rendered SVG string, and 'option' will return the valid VISALL configuration.
